p: Persons with obesity around the world are already at high risk for severe complications of COVID‚Äê19, by virtue of the increased risk of the chronic diseases that obesity drives. While China does not have the high incidence of obesity as that in the US when obesity is defined by BMI, China has been experiencing an epidemic of type 2 diabetes, with prevalence rates similar to the US ( 5). The reason for this is that individuals of Asian descent have a propensity for ectopic and visceral fat storage, while those of European descent are storing more of the excess fat in subcutaneous depots, with a lesser lipotoxic profile. The Chinese experience needs to inform the health system response in other countries around the world.
